# UD Coptic Scriptorium

Language: [Coptic](../cop/overview/cop-hub.html) (code: `cop`)<br/>
Family: Afro-Asiatic, Egyptian

This treebank has been part of Universal Dependencies since the UD v1.4 release.

The following people have contributed to making this treebank part of UD: Mitchell Abrams, Elizabeth Davidson, Amir Zeldes.

Repository: [UD_Coptic-Scriptorium](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Coptic-Scriptorium)<br />
Search this treebank on-line: [PML-TQ](https://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/pmltq/#!/treebank/udcop_scriptorium)

License: CC BY 4.0

Genre: bible, fiction, nonfiction

Questions, comments?
General annotation questions (either Coptic-specific or cross-linguistic) can be raised in the [main UD issue tracker](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues).
You can report bugs in this treebank in the [treebank-specific issue tracker on Github](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Coptic-Scriptorium/issues).
If you want to collaborate, please contact [amir&nbsp;•&nbsp;zeldes&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;georgetown&nbsp;•&nbsp;edu].
Development of the treebank happens directly in the UD repository, so you may submit bug fixes as pull requests against the dev branch.

| Annotation | Source |
|------------|--------|
| Lemmas | annotated manually, natively in UD style |
| UPOS | annotated manually in non-UD style, automatically converted to UD |
| XPOS | annotated manually |
| Features | assigned by a program, not checked manually |
| Relations | annotated manually, natively in UD style |

## Description

UD Coptic contains manually annotated Sahidic Coptic texts, currently from the Gospel of Mark, Shenoute of Atripe's "Not Because a Fox Barks", the Letters of Besa, and several short stories from the Apophthegmata Patrum.



The Coptic Universal Dependency Treebank is a manually annotated corpus of Sahidic Coptic texts, currently containing excerpts from the Sahidic New Testament Gospel of Mark, Archmandrite Shenoute of Atripe's "Not Because a Fox Barks", the Letters of Besa, and several short stories from the Apophthegmata Patrum (Sayings of the Desert Fathers). Detailed information about the treebank is available here:

https://corpling.uis.georgetown.edu/coptic-treebank/

The data was digitized and annotated manually for part of speech in the project Coptic Scriptorium. For individual credit and further information see:

http://copticscriptorium.org/

Coptic POS tags come from the Coptic Scriptorium tag set, which is available from the project and treebank websites.

## Acknowledgments

The underlying POS tagged material was produced as part of the projects Coptic Scriptorium, KOMeT and KELLIA, funded by the NEH in the USA and BMBF and DFG in Germany (see http://copticscriptorium.org/ for more details). Treebank annotation was done by Mitchell Abrams, Liz Davidson and Amir Zeldes.

<h2>Tokenization and Word Segmentation</h2>


<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 514 sentences, 6109 tokens and 13196 syntactic words.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>All tokens in this corpus are followed by a space.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain words with spaces.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 3 types of words that contain both letters and punctuation. Examples: ·ⲻ, [ⲉⲃⲟ]ⲗ, ϭⲙ[ϣⲓ]ⲛⲉ</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 3875 multi-word tokens. On average, one multi-word token consists of 2.83 syntactic words.</li>
<li>There are 2614 types of multi-word tokens. Examples: ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ, ⲙⲙⲟⲥ, ⲛⲁϥ, ⲛⲁⲩ, ⲙⲙⲟϥ, ⲛⲧϩⲉ, ⲉⲣⲟϥ, ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ, ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ, ⲛⲧⲉⲩⲛⲟⲩ, ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ, ⲉⲣⲟⲟⲩ, ⲉϥϫⲱ, ⲛϩⲏⲧϥ, ⲛϩⲏⲧⲟⲩ, ⲁⲩⲉⲓ, ⲛⲥⲱϥ, ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ, ⲛⲏⲧⲛ, ⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ, ⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ, ⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ, ⲁϥⲃⲱⲕ, ⲁϥⲉⲓ, ⲛϩⲏⲧ, ⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ, ⲛⲁⲕ, ⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ, ⲉⲣⲱⲧⲛ, ⲉⲩϫⲱ, ⲙⲙⲟⲕ, ⲛϩⲏⲧⲧⲏⲩⲧⲛ, ⲛⲁⲕⲁⲑⲁⲣⲧⲟⲛ, ⲛⲙⲙⲉ, ⲡϣⲏⲣⲉ, ⲡⲟⲩⲁ, ⲙⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ, ⲛⲁⲥⲛⲏⲩ, ⲛⲗⲁⲁⲩ, ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲩ, ⲛⲧⲉⲓϩⲉ, ⲡⲉⲡⲛⲉⲩⲙⲁ, ⲧⲏⲣⲥ, ϣⲁⲣⲱⲧⲛ, ϩⲉⲛⲕⲟⲟⲩⲉ, ϫⲉⲉⲧⲃⲉⲟⲩ, ϯⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ, ⲁϥϫⲟⲟⲥ, ⲁϥⲛⲁⲩ, ⲉⲣⲟⲕ.</li>
</ul>

<h3>Tags</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 14 UPOS tags out of 17 possible: <a>ADP</a>, <a>ADV</a>, <a>AUX</a>, <a>CCONJ</a>, <a>DET</a>, <a>NOUN</a>, <a>NUM</a>, <a>PART</a>, <a>PRON</a>, <a>PROPN</a>, <a>PUNCT</a>, <a>SCONJ</a>, <a>VERB</a>, <a>X</a></li>
<li>This corpus does not use the following tags: ADJ, INTJ, SYM</li>
</ul>

  <li>2
    <ul>
      <li>DET: ⲡⲉⲕ, ⲛⲉⲕ, ⲛⲉⲧⲛ, ⲡⲟⲩ, ⲧⲟⲩ, ⲛⲟⲩ, ⲡⲉⲧⲛ, ⲧⲉⲕ</li>
      <li>PRON: ⲕ, ⲧⲉⲧⲛ, ⲧⲛ, ⲉ, ⲧⲏⲩⲧⲛ, ⲅ, ⲛⲧⲱⲧⲛ, ⲧⲉ, ⲛⲧⲟⲕ, ⲉⲣⲟ</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>3
    <ul>
      <li>DET: ⲡⲉϥ, ⲛⲉϥ, ⲛⲉⲩ, ⲧⲉϥ, ⲡⲉⲩ, ⲧⲉⲩ, ⲡⲉⲥ, ⲧⲉⲥ, ⲛⲉⲥ</li>
      <li>PRON: ϥ, ⲩ, ⲥ, ⲟⲩ, ⲥⲉ, ⲛⲧⲟϥ, ⲉⲩⲉ, ⲛⲧⲟⲟⲩ, ⲉϥⲉ, ⲉⲩϣⲁⲛ</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>




<h3>Other Features</h3>


<h2>Syntax</h2>

<h3>Auxiliary Verbs and Copula</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 2 lemmas as copulas (<a>cop</a>). Examples: ⲡⲉ, ⲡ.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 32 lemmas as auxiliaries (<a>aux</a>). Examples: ⲁ, ⲛⲁ, ⲛⲧⲉ, ⲙⲡⲉ, ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉ, ϣⲁⲣⲉ, ϣ, ⲛⲛⲉ, ⲉⲣϣⲁⲛ, ⲙⲁⲣⲉ, ⲙⲛ, ϣⲁⲛⲧⲉ, ⲙⲡⲁⲧⲉ, ⲉ, ⲟⲩⲛ, ⲙⲉ, ⲙⲉⲣⲉ, ⲉⲣϣⲁⲛ_ⲛⲧⲟⲕ, ⲙⲡⲣⲧⲣⲉ, ⲛ, ⲧⲁⲣ, ⲧⲁⲣⲉ, ϣⲁ, ϣⲁⲁⲣⲉ, ⲉⲣⲉ_ⲁⲛⲟⲕ, ⲙⲁ, ⲙⲙⲛⲧⲉ, ⲙⲛⲧⲉ, ⲛⲉϣ, ⲛⲉⲣⲉ, ⲡⲁⲓ, ⲡⲉϫⲉ.</li>
</ul>

<h3>Core Arguments, Oblique Arguments and Adjuncts</h3>

Here we consider only relations between verbs (parent) and nouns or pronouns (child).
<ul>
  <li><a>nsubj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN (31)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON (6)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN (149)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-ADP(ϩⲓⲣⲛ) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-ADP(ⲛ) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON (1035)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>obj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN (1)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN (99)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-ADP(ϩⲛ) (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-ADP(ⲉ) (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-ADP(ⲙⲛ) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-ADP(ⲛ) (108)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-ADP(ⲛⲧⲛ) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON (188)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-ADP(ⲉ) (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-ADP(ⲛ) (108)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-ADP(ⲛⲁ) (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-ADP(ⲛⲧⲛ) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--NOUN (10)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--NOUN-ADP(ⲛ) (6)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON (16)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-ADP(ⲛ) (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-ADP(ⲛⲁ) (1)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>iobj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN (2)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON (16)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON-ADP(ⲛ) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON (1)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>




<h3>Relations Overview</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not use relation subtypes.</li>
<li>The following 6 relation types are not used in this corpus at all: <a>expl</a>, <a>clf</a>, <a>compound</a>, <a>list</a>, <a>goeswith</a>, <a>reparandum</a></li>
</ul>
